newsitem.title: UK: Innovative Technology up after H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Innovative Technology up after H1 results.

text.p: Shares in Innovative Technology Plc jumped on Wednesday after the maker of woundcare products posted a sharp rise in gross profits and said it was looking for substantial worldwide growth now its sales network is in place.
The stock, floated in December 1994, was up 22p at 162-1/2 by 1238 GMT in volume of 155,672 shares.

Innovative Technology said its gross profit rose to 171,830 stg in the first half ended June 30 from 60,375 a year before, though heavy investment costs produced a pretax loss of 1.7 million stg, up from 1.2 million a year earlier.
Chairman Ronald Somerville said: "The planning and investment process at Innovative Technologies continues to reflect our confidence in the quality of our woundcare products."
"We foresee substantial growth in the global market for our products and our selling network is in place."
